column4: I am in the Unreal installer and trying to set a target path. The default is 'user/local/games/UT2004' The error is no write permissions. What can I do to get around this?
sudo sh ./"installer"
that is how I should start the installer? So I should not use the UT2004 installer?
how did you start the installer from the beginning?
cd yourself into the correct directory then sudo sh ./<insert whatever the installer is called here>
I double click on the linux install from the CD - asks me some questions - Tells me it is a x86 machine - then I am to select a place for install
First of all copy the installer file to your home directory ;)
oh, I copied it to a ut folder
Else you'll have troubles when switching CDs
brb doing what Azzco my new heros says
cd /path/to/installer | sudo sh "installer name" I think that should do it as long as the installer is run as root
I can't move it to home
ok
Can't copy it!?
I was typing as that came up
doing it now
I am typing in this... but I don't know what is wrong with it. cd linus-installer.sh | sudo sh linux-installer.sh
i have more than one cdrom drive
Where did you copy the installer?
it didn't copy the installer, it had an error
no such file or directory
what is wrong with this line: cd linus-installer.sh | sudo sh linux-installer.sh
